content:
cilium-dbg bpf 
 Direct access to local BPF maps 
 Options 
   -h, --help   help for bpf
 
 Options inherited from parent commands 
       --config string        Config file (default is $HOME/.cilium.yaml)
  -D, --debug                Enable debug messages
  -H, --host string          URI to server-side API
      --log-driver strings   Logging endpoints to use (example: syslog)
      --log-opt map          Log driver options (example: format=json)
 
 SEE ALSO 
 
 cilium-dbg 	 - CLI 
 cilium-dbg bpf auth 	 - Manage authenticated connections between identities 
 cilium-dbg bpf bandwidth 	 - BPF datapath bandwidth settings 
 cilium-dbg bpf config 	 - Manage runtime config 
 cilium-dbg bpf ct 	 - Connection tracking tables 
 cilium-dbg bpf egress 	 - Manage the egress routing rules 
 cilium-dbg bpf endpoint 	 - Local endpoint map 
 cilium-dbg bpf frag 	 - Manage the IPv4 datagram fragments 
 cilium-dbg bpf fs 	 - BPF filesystem mount 
 cilium-dbg bpf ipcache 	 - Manage the IPCache mappings for IP/CIDR <-> Identity 
 cilium-dbg bpf ipmasq 	 - ip-masq-agent CIDRs 
 cilium-dbg bpf lb 	 - Load-balancing configuration 
 cilium-dbg bpf metrics 	 - BPF datapath traffic metrics 
 cilium-dbg bpf multicast 	 - Manage multicast BPF programs 
 cilium-dbg bpf nat 	 - NAT mapping tables 
 cilium-dbg bpf nodeid 	 - Manage the node IDs 
 cilium-dbg bpf policy 	 - Manage policy related BPF maps 
 cilium-dbg bpf sha 	 - Manage compiled BPF template objects 
 cilium-dbg bpf socknat 	 - Socket NAT operations 
 cilium-dbg bpf srv6 	 - Manage the SRv6 routing rules 
 cilium-dbg bpf vtep 	 - Manage the VTEP mappings for IP/CIDR <-> VTEP MAC/IP
